body.p:
The Course: of the Syn: We were gratified at being able, yesterday, to
comply with the courteous invitation extended
to us, to witness the ceremonies attending the consecration of
the new Synagogue on Jackson Street.

The frequenters of the Old Musical Hall would find
it difficult to recognize the place so often visited, in the
metamorphosis it has since undergone.

The middle rows of seats have been mostly taken out
and those on the sides are extended to the walls §
a magnificent chandelier, having some 26 lights, descends
from the centre, The floor is elegantly carpeted.*
The whole building has been freshly painted and all its

The ceremonies of conservation were commenced by
the minister reading Ezek XI vs 16 Is ? 41, 43_
The choir then chanted the ave "Give thanks unto the Lord˶
The minister read the dedication Hymn, and the Choir
sung "All creation praise the Lord˶

At the conclusion of the Hymn, the Scrolls containing
the Holy Laws were brought into the Synagogue, the
whole congregation rising as it was borne to its ap-
propriate place.

This was followed by the reading of various passages
by the minister and responses by the choir.

After a prayer for the Welfare of the Government of
the United States, this city city and all denomina-
tions professing a reverence for the Almighty, came
the Lecture.

The speaker, though a little more than* a twelve month
in the country, spoke our language with considerable
distinctness, and by attention could be readily followed
His discourse was plain, making no pretensions to
eloquence. He spoke feelingly, however, of the ad-
vantages enjoyed by the Israelites in this land of free
dom, and glowingly of the period, when despotism
shall have ceased from the earth and the glorious
light of which the Prophets spake shall irradiate
all lands. He adverted to the growth of Mobile, and
to the prosperity that permitted his people to fill up
so handsome a temple in which to worship.

They passed off, we believe, very much to the satisfaction

and will not soon be forgotten. We heard the excellence
of the choir particularly commended. We congratulate
our Hebrew fellow-citizens upon their prosperous con-
dition, and upon the beautiful temple they have
consecrated to the Holy purposes of the Sanctuary,
